types.name: Query
types.description: The "Query" type is the root of all GraphQL queries.

args.name: state
args.description: Filter the feature flags by state.

args.name: type
args.description: Filter the feature flags by type.

fields.name: userContactPersons
fields.description:
Get user contact persons

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

fields.name: userBillingAddresses
fields.description:
get users billing addresses

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

fields.name: bankAccounts
fields.description:
Returns the bank accounts of the user who is making the request

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

fields.name: getBookingOffer
fields.description:
Get a booking offer by ID

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

fields.name: possibleToCreateContractForExtensionRequest
fields.description:
Query if contract can be created for a given extension request.

Viewer needs to be authenticated. Or have an
    access token allowing the POSSIBLE_TO_CREATE_CONTRACT_FOR_EXTENSION_REQUEST action.

fields.name: latestBookingOffer
fields.description:
Query to find latest booking offer by a booking offer ID

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

fields.name: latestBookingOfferByListingRequest
fields.description:
Query to find latest booking offer by a booking offer ID

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

fields.name: shortlist
fields.description:
Query shortlists

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

fields.name: shortlistsSummary
fields.description:
Query shortlistsSummary

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

fields.name: landlordBookingsByListingId
fields.description:
Get bookings for a listing

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

fields.name: landlordBookingsByGroupId
fields.description:
Get bookings for a listing group

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

fields.name: landlordBookingByListingRequestId
fields.description:
Get booking by booking offer

Viewer needs to be authenticated. Or have an
    access token allowing the GET_BOOKING_BY_LISTING_REQUEST_ID action.

fields.name: role
fields.description:
Returns a UserRole given id.
Viewer needs to have the role "DEVELOPER".

fields.name: roles
fields.description:
Returns a roles connection.
Viewer needs to have the role "DEVELOPER".

fields.name: userById
fields.description:
Returns a user given its id or null if the user cannot be found.
Viewer needs to have the role "DEVELOPER".

fields.name: userByEmail
fields.description:
Returns a user given its email or null if the user cannot be found.
Viewer needs to have the role "DEVELOPER".

fields.name: users
fields.description:
Returns a user connection.
Viewer needs to have the role "DEVELOPER".

fields.name: emailExists
fields.description: Returns a boolean, true if the email exists in the database, false if not.

fields.name: landlordListings
fields.description:
Returns a landlords's listings. By default it returns the listings of whoever is
currently logged in.
May only be used to fetch listings from the POV of a landlord.

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

args.name: landlord
args.description:
The user whose listing should be returned. Defaults to the authenticated
user.

args.name: after
args.description: Returns the elements in the list that come after the specified cursor.

args.name: before
args.description: Returns the elements in the list that come before the specified cursor.

args.name: first
args.description: Returns the first *n* elements from the list.

args.name: last
args.description: Returns the last *n* elements from the list.

fields.name: listing
fields.description:
Returns a listing. Either `_id` or `groupId` must be set. If neither is set
this always returns null. If both are set this searches for listing with a
matching `_id` and `groupId` will be ignored.
May only be used to fetch listings from the POV of a landlord.

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

fields.name: landlordListingById
fields.description:
Returns a listing for a landlord by _id.
May only be used to fetch listings from the POV of a landlord.

Viewer needs to be authenticated. Or have an
    access token allowing the GET_LANDLORD_LISTING_BY_ID action.

fields.name: landlordListingByGroupId
fields.description:
Returns a multilisting for a landlord by groupId.
May only be used to fetch listings from the POV of a landlord.

Viewer needs to be authenticated. Or have an
    access token allowing the GET_LANDLORD_LISTING_BY_GROUP_ID action.

fields.name: publicListingsByGroupIds
fields.description:
Takes a list of group IDs and returns a list of groups in the same order. If
there is no group with that ID or the group is not public (unpublished,
deleted or inactive) this will return `null` in its place.

fields.name: getCostCalculation
fields.description:
Returns the CostCalculation which contains rent cost for a period
particular interval.

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

fields.name: landlordListingRequests
fields.description:
Returns a landlord's listing requests. By default returns the listing requests of
whoever is currently logged in.

May only be used to fetch listing requests from the POV of a landlord.

`overlappingListingRequests` will always be an empty array for performance
reasons. Use `landlordListingRequest` if you want to access that data.

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

args.name: landlord
args.description:
The user whose listing requests should be returned. Defaults to the
authenticated user. If `_id` or `groupId` are set this will be ignored.

args.name: listing
args.description:
The listing whose listing requests should be returned. If null it will
return all listing requests for all listings the viewer owns. If this is set
`landlord` and `groupId` will be ignored.

args.name: group
args.description:
The group whose listing requests should be returned. If null it will return
all listing requests for all listings the viewer owns. If this is set
`landlord` will be ignored. If _id is set as well this will be ignored.

args.name: landlordStatusFilters
args.description: The landlord statuses the listing request should have.

args.name: after
args.description: Returns the elements in the list that come after the specified cursor.

args.name: before
args.description: Returns the elements in the list that come before the specified cursor.

args.name: first
args.description: Returns the first *n* elements from the list.

args.name: last
args.description: Returns the last *n* elements from the list.

fields.name: landlordListingRequest
fields.description:
Returns a listing request for a landlord

Viewer needs to be authenticated. Or have an
    access token allowing the GET_LISTING_REQUEST action.

args.name: bookingRequestId
args.description: The booking request id

args.name: listingRequestId
args.description: The listing request id

fields.name: getRequestStatesForMultilisting
fields.description:
Returns the RequestState for every listing in a particular group during in a
particular interval.

Viewer needs to be authenticated. Or have an
    access token allowing the GET_REQUEST_STATES_FOR_MULTILISTING action.

args.name: group
args.description: The concerned groups id.

args.name: from
args.description: From date of the concerned interval.

args.name: to
args.description: To date of the concerned interval.

fields.name: getListingViewedInSearchResultsListMetrics
fields.description:
Get listings viewed aggregated data

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

args.name: intervals
args.description: Time intervals for the grouping of data

fields.name: getListingDetailsViewedMetrics
fields.description:
Get listing details viewed aggregated data

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

args.name: intervals
args.description: Time intervals for the grouping of data

fields.name: getListingRequestsForListingMetrics
fields.description:
Get listing requrests for listings aggregated data

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

args.name: intervals
args.description: Time intervals for the grouping of data

fields.name: listingEarningsMetrics
fields.description:
Get earnings for a listing aggregated data

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

args.name: intervals
args.description: Time intervals for the grouping of data

fields.name: listingPublishTimeline
fields.description:
Get earnings for a listing aggregated data

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

args.name: intervals
args.description: Time intervals for the grouping of data

fields.name: blockWillDeclineListingRequests
fields.description:
Returns the listing requests that would get declined if a block would be
created using that `from` and `to`.

Viewer needs to be authenticated. Or have an
    access token allowing the GET_LISTING_REQUESTS_THAT_WILL_BE_DECLINED_FOR_BLOCK action.

args.name: groupId
args.description: The group id of the listing that is supposed to be blocked.

args.name: from
args.description: From date of the block.

args.name: to
args.description: To date of the block.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: FeatureFlagState
types.description: State filter for feature flags.

enumValues.name: ALL
enumValues.description: Returns feature flags disregarding their state.

enumValues.name: DISABLED
enumValues.description: Only returns feature flags with `enabled: false`

enumValues.name: ENABLED
enumValues.description: Only returns feature flags with `enabled: true`

types.name: FeatureFlagsType
types.description: Type filter for feature flags.

enumValues.name: ALL
enumValues.description: Returns feature flags disregarding their type.

enumValues.name: GLOBAL
enumValues.description: Only returns feature flags with `type: GLOBAL`.

enumValues.name: USER
enumValues.description: Only returns feature flags with `type: USER`.

types.name: FeatureFlag
types.description: Describes a feature flag and it's state.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the feature flag.

fields.name: enabled
fields.description:
If the feature flag is enabled. This is always true for feature flags with the
type USER.

fields.name: type
fields.description: If the feature flag is a global one or assigned to a user.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: LandlordContactPerson
types.description: Contact person Type

types.name: BillingAddress
types.description: Billing address Type

types.name: BankAccount
types.description: The bank account.

fields.name: _id
fields.description: An id uniquely identifying the bank account.

fields.name: depositAccount
fields.description:
The bank account that is designated for tenant's deposits. The landlord can
choose to get tenant's deposits into a different account than is used for the
rental payments.

types.name: ObjectId
types.description: Mongodb ObjectId

types.name: BankAccountOwnerAddress
types.description: The bank account's owner's address.

types.name: Date
types.description: Date

types.name: BookingOffer
types.description: The booking offer.

fields.name: _id
fields.description: An id uniquely identifying the booking offer.

fields.name: price
fields.description: Amount of Rent to be paid

fields.name: deposit
fields.description: Amount of Deposit to be paid

fields.name: bankAccountId
fields.description: The id of the bank account for rent

fields.name: depositBankAccountId
fields.description: The id of the bank account for deposit

fields.name: isOnlineSigning
fields.description: Flag to specify whether Online Signing was opted or not

fields.name: stageHistory
fields.description: All previous history of booking offer's stage

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of request for this booking offer. I.e. Standard or Extension

fields.name: listing
fields.description: Listing for which booking offer is created

fields.name: bookingRequest
fields.description: An id uniquely identifying the Booking Request

fields.name: listingRequestId
fields.description: An id uniquely identifying the Listing Request

fields.name: contractType
fields.description: Contract type i.e. b2c or b2b

fields.name: cancellationReason
fields.description: Cancellation Reason if the booking offer is canceled

fields.name: tenantNames
fields.description: Name of all the tenants who are going to stay

fields.name: optionToExtend
fields.description: Is there option to extend current stay

fields.name: keysInformation
fields.description: Keys information contain language specific data

fields.name: timeOfFirstPayment
fields.description: When would be the first rent would be paid

fields.name: timeOfDepositPayment
fields.description: When would be the deposit would be paid

fields.name: rentalContractHtmlUrl
fields.description: URL for the rental contract page for online signing HTML

fields.name: rentalContractPdfUrl
fields.description: URL for the rental contract page for online signing PDF

fields.name: authorisedSignatory
fields.description: Authorised Signatory of the tenant, if any

fields.name: firstMonthsRent
fields.description: Rent for first month, if stay is partial for first month

fields.name: lastMonthsRent
fields.description: Rent for last month, if stay is partial for last month

fields.name: invoiceLanguage
fields.description: Language in which the invoice has to be sent to Landlord

fields.name: paidBy
fields.description: Then amount is paid by whom

fields.name: reasonForStayExplanation
fields.description: More descriptive explaination of stay by tenant

fields.name: salesRepresentativeId
fields.description: An id uniquely identifying the Booking Manager

fields.name: createdBy
fields.description: An id uniquely identifying the person who created the contract

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Date on which the contract is created

fields.name: duration
fields.description: The requested duration in months and days

fields.name: listingVacantDays
fields.description: The amount of vacant days a booking offer will generate

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

fields.name: _id

fields.name: apartmentName

fields.name: minBookingDuration

Basic numeric attributes of a listing
This should enforce the consistency among all the types which somehow links to Listings

fields.name: beds

fields.name: thumbnail

types.description: Services offered in listing

types.name: BookingOfferListingAmenities
types.description: Amenities offered in listing

types.name: BookingOfferAmountPaymentTimeline
types.description: Enum to specify the time for rent payment & deposit payment

enumValues.name: ONE_MONTH_BEFORE
enumValues.description: Pay one month before the contract starts

types.name: BookingOfferContactPerson
types.description: Contact person in a booking offer

types.name: BookingOfferAdditionalCost
types.description: Additional cost in a booking offer

fields.name: includeInLandlordInvoice
fields.description: Should this cost be included in landlord invoice

types.name: TenantPayments
types.description:
A cost summary for a stay. This may change soon since we use a different code in
the CRM for generating the contracts and we want to probably unify those.

fields.name: instalment
fields.description:
The first instalment in cents. Usually contains the first month's rent and the
deposit. Can contain the second month's rent as well if the first month is too
short.
fields.deprecationReason: I think Sasha and Carlos worked on something that calculates the first and last payment in @wunderflats/common/lib/costs

fields.name: months
fields.description: The rent per month in cents.

fields.name: totalRent
fields.description: The the total rent for the whole stay in cents.

types.name: TenantPaymentsMonth
types.description: The rent per month in cents.

fields.name: month
fields.description: The first day of the concerned month.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The rent in cents for the concerned month.

types.name: Duration
types.description: A duration in full months and remaining days.

fields.name: days
fields.description:
The days remaining for the requested interval after subtracting all the full
months.

fields.name: months
fields.description: The full months in the requested interval.

types.name: VacancyPeriod
types.description: Vacancy before and after a period

fields.name: after
fields.description: Amount of days vacant after it's null if there is no block after the current period being checked or there is no listing.availableTo set

types.description: result when contract can be created

types.name: PossibleToCreateContractForExtensionRequestPayloadNegative
types.description: result when contract cannot be created

fields.name: reason
fields.description: If the contract cannot be created, the reason will have the error key

Offline group which will appear in the shortlist.

types.name: LandlordBookingsConnection
types.description: A list of listings or groups of listings.

fields.name: totalCount
fields.description: Identifies the total count of items in the connection.

types.name: LandlordBooking
types.description: A Landlord booking

fields.name: reasonForStay
fields.description:
Reason for stay

This field is an enum and can be either of:
* APPRENTICESHIP
* WORK
* INTERNSHIP
* STUDYING
* INTERIM
* TEMPORARY_HOUSING_NEED
* OTHER

types.name: StayDuration
types.description: Duration of stay

types.name: LandlordListingRequest
types.description: A listing request as it should be seen by a landlord of the requested listing.

fields.name: adults
fields.description: The amount of adults who are supposed to live in the flat.

fields.name: children
fields.description: The amount of children who are supposed to live in the flat.

fields.name: from
fields.description: When the tenant wants to move in.

fields.name: id
fields.description: An id uniquely identifying the listing request.

fields.name: bookingRequestId
fields.description: The id of the booking request this listing request is part of.

fields.name: listing
fields.description: A snapshot of the requested listing.

fields.name: tenantPayments
fields.description: The cost summary of the stay.

fields.name: listingVacantDays
fields.description: Possible Vacancy dates accepting this request will generate

fields.name: optionToExtend
fields.description: If the tenant wishes to possibly extend the stay in the apartment.

fields.name: pets
fields.description: The pets that will move in.

fields.name: reasonForStay
fields.description:
The reason for why the tenant needs the flat.

This field is an enum and can be either of:
* APPRENTICESHIP
* WORK
* INTERNSHIP
* STUDYING
* INTERIM
* TEMPORARY_HOUSING_NEED
* OTHER

fields.name: universityName
fields.description:
The name of the university the tenant studies at. This will be an empty string
unless the tenant chose `STUDYING` for `reasonForStay`.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status the request is in.

fields.name: tenantInformation
fields.description: Information about the tenant making the request.

fields.name: to
fields.description: When the tenant wants to move in.

fields.name: reserved
fields.description: If the listing request is the reserved one in the booking request.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: When the request was updated the last time.
fields.deprecationReason: Why would the landlord need that?

fields.name: duration
fields.description: The requested duration in months and days.

fields.name: tenantInNegotiations
fields.description: The summary of the negotiations for the current booking request.

fields.name: landlordStatus
fields.description: Simplified listingRequest as is relevant to the landlord

fields.name: latestBookingOffer
fields.description: The lastest booking offer for the listing request

fields.name: fullLatestBookingOffer
fields.description: The full Booking Offer from the latestBookingOffer

fields.name: overlappingListingRequests
fields.description:
Array of overlapping listing requests.

****IMPORTANT****
Will only work normally when using`QUERY landlordListingRequest`.
This field will always return `null` when using `QUERY landlordListingRequests`
for performance reasons.
****IMPORTANT****

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: LandlordListing
types.description:
LandlordListing
A listing from the POV of its landlord.

fields.name: apartmentName
fields.description: The apartment's location in the building.

fields.name: locationWithinBuilding
fields.description: The apartment's location in the building. new field

fields.name: beds
fields.description: The amount of beds the apartment has.

fields.name: externalId
fields.description:
An external ID that can be set by the landlord to identify the apartment more
easily on wunderflats.com.

fields.name: groupId
fields.description: The listing's groupId used to group similar listings.

fields.name: partOfGroup
fields.description: A boolean that should always be false.

fields.name: published
fields.description: If the listing is published. If false it cannot be seen on wunderflats.com.

fields.name: lastPublishedAt
fields.description: The date and time of when the listing was last published.

fields.name: lastUnpublishedAt
fields.description: The date and time of when the listing was last unpublished.

types.name: LandlordGroupOrListing
types.description: Either a group or a listing from the POV of its landlord.

fields.name: address
fields.description:
The group's address.

Only visible to landlords.

fields.name: partOfGroup
fields.description: A boolean that should always be true.

types.name: ListingAddress
types.description: An address object that is used by listings and groups.

types.name: Title
types.description: A listing's title.

types.name: TranslatableField
types.description: Translatable field

types.name: CurrentListingState
types.description:
The state a listing can be in to easily identify if the landlord nees to take
action or not.

types.name: VACANT_SOON
types.description:
(The apartment is not currently available because it is rented out in
Wunderflats **AND** the move-out date of the current tenant is in less than 31
days)
**OR**
(The apartment is not currently available because it is in a blocked period until
less than 31 days* **AND** *the move-in date of the next tenant is more than the
minimum booking duration away)
**OR**
(the first day of the next blocked period is in more than the minimum booking
duration).

fields.name: vacantFrom
fields.description: First day it can be requested again.

types.name: OCCUPIED
types.description:
The apartment is not currently available because it is rented out in
Wunderflats.

types.name: BLOCKED
types.description:
The apartment is currently available but the first date of the next block is
closer than the minimum Booking duration.

types.name: BOOKED
types.description:
The apartment is currently available AND the next move-in date is closer than
the minimum Booking duration.

types.name: VACANT
types.description: The apartment is currently available.

types.name: NOT_AVAILABLE
types.description: The apartment is currently not available.

types.name: Work
types.description: The tenant's work information.

fields.name: companyName
fields.description: The company the tenant is working at.

types.name: ListingRequestStatus
types.description: The listing requests status.

fields.name: setAt
fields.description: When the state was last changed
fields.deprecationReason: Why does the landlord need that and does it need to be DateTime?

fields.name: type
fields.description: The status type the listing request is currently in.

fields.name: data
fields.description: Data related to the status of the listing request

types.name: ListingRequestStatusType
types.description: The status types a listing request can be in.

enumValues.name: AVAILABLE
enumValues.description: The listing is available and the landlord is interested in the tenant.

enumValues.name: AV_CHECK
enumValues.description: The landlord has been contacted and we're waiting for an answer.

enumValues.name: NOT_AVAILABLE
enumValues.description: Then listing is not available, or at least not for this tenant.

enumValues.name: NO_AV_CHECK
enumValues.description:
The landlord has not been contacted, we don't know if the listing may be
available.

enumValues.name: SECOND_CHANCE
enumValues.description:
The listing used to be `NOT_AVAILABLE`, but it's not anymore. Contacting the
landlord may be viable.

enumValues.name: TENANT_WITHDREW
enumValues.description: The tenant withdrew the request and is not interested in any listing anymore.

types.name: ListingRequestStatusData
types.description: Data related to the status of the listing request

fields.name: reason
fields.description: E.g. reason why landlord declined or reason why tenant withdrew

fields.name: suppressingBookingRequestId
fields.description: suppressingBookingRequestId either for NO_AV_CHECK or NOT_AVAILABLE reason DECLINED_BY_CONFLICT

fields.name: suppressingListingRequestId
fields.description: suppressinglistingRequestId either for NO_AV_CHECK or NOT_AVAILABLE reason DECLINED_BY_CONFLICT

types.name: TenantInformation
types.description: Tenant information.

types.name: ListingRequestNegotiationType
types.description: A short summary of the state of negotiations of the booking request.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The actual status of the negotiations.

fields.name: listingRequestId
fields.description: The id of the listing request in negotiation if it belongs to the same landlord.

fields.name: bookingRequestId
fields.description: The id of the booking request matching the listing request if it belongs to the same landlord.

types.name: ListingRequestNegotiationEnum
types.description: Different possible states of in negotiations from the listing request perspective.

enumValues.name: NO
enumValues.description: There is no other listing request in negotiations.

enumValues.name: WITH_OTHER_LANDLORD
enumValues.description: There is another listing request in negotiation, with another landlord.

enumValues.name: WITH_SAME_LANDLORD
enumValues.description: There is another listing request in negotiation, with the same landlord.

types.name: LandlordStatusType
types.description: Summary of the state of the request for the landlord

enumValues.name: CONTRACT_WAITING_FOR_TENANT
enumValues.description: Contract is created and landlord signed

types.name: ListingRequestType
types.description: Summary of the state of the request for the landlord

types.name: LatestBookingOffer
types.description: Latest Booking offer

types.name: BookingOfferStatusEnum
types.description: Booking offer statuses

enumValues.name: ACCEPTED
enumValues.description: Booking offer accepted by both parties

enumValues.name: CANCELED
enumValues.description: Booking offer has been canceled, and this could be for a correction of the contract

enumValues.name: REJECTED
enumValues.description: Booking offer rejected by one of the parties

types.name: OverlappingListingRequest
types.description: ListingRequests that overlap a specific listing request

fields.description: Booking request Id of the overlapping request

fields.name: listingRequestId

fields.name: wouldBeDeclined
fields.description: Would this request be declined by accepting the other one

types.description: Cursor

types.name: UserRoleType
types.description:
Describes the roles a user can have. By default a user has no roles. Some
queries can only be used if the user has a specific role.

enumValues.name: ACCOUNTING
enumValues.description: A user having this role works for wunderflats in the accounting department.

enumValues.name: DEVELOPER
enumValues.description: A user having this role works for wunderflats in the IT department.

enumValues.name: FSU
enumValues.description: A user having this role works for wunderflats in the FSU department

enumValues.name: SALES
enumValues.description: A user having this role works for wunderflats.

enumValues.name: SCAM
enumValues.description:
A user having this role works for wunderflats and has access to the scam
checking queries and mutations.

enumValues.name: TEST
enumValues.description:
No user should have this role in production. This allows using queries that
are only meant for test setups.

types.name: UserRole
types.description: A roles is a user can have. Roles grant access to certain queries.

types.description:
LandlordGroup
A listing group from the POV of its landlord.

fields.name: address
fields.description:
The group's address.

Only visible to landlords.

fields.name: group
fields.description:
A collection of the apartments in this group. Only contains the properties
that can be different per apartment in a group.

fields.name: partOfGroup
fields.description: A boolean that should always be true.

types.description:
LandlordListingInGroup
A listing in a group from the POV of its landlord. Only contains the properties that can be different per
apartment in a group.

fields.name: apartmentName
fields.description: The apartment's location in the building.

fields.name: locationWithinBuilding
fields.description: The apartment's location in the building. new field

fields.name: availableFrom
fields.description:
When is the listing generally available (meaning it can be requested/booked).
This date is inclusive.

fields.name: availableTo
fields.description:
When is the listing generally not available (meaning it cannot be
requested/booked). This date is inclusive.

fields.name: externalId
fields.description:
An external ID that can be set by the landlord to identify the apartment more
easily on wunderflats.com.

fields.name: floor
fields.description: The floor the apartment is on

fields.name: published
fields.description: If the listing is published. If false it cannot be seen on wunderflats.com.

fields.name: lastPublishedAt
fields.description: The date and time of when the sublisting was last published.

fields.name: lastUnpublishedAt
fields.description: The date and time of when the sublisting was last unpublished.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time of when the sublisting was created.

fields.description: Wether the listing is reserved in any listing request during the asked interval.

fields.name: available

types.name: Mutation
types.description: Root level mutation so that others can extend on top of it

fields.name: activateGlobalFeatureFlags
fields.description:
Activates a global feature flag.
Viewer needs to have the role "DEVELOPER".

fields.name: deactivateGlobalFeatureFlags
fields.description:
Deactivates a global feature flag.
Viewer needs to have the role "DEVELOPER".

fields.name: createContactPerson
fields.description:
Create contact person

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

fields.name: deleteContactPerson
fields.description:
Delete contact person

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

fields.name: createBillingAddress
fields.description:
Create billing address

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

fields.name: deleteBillingAddress
fields.description:
Delete billing address

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

fields.name: setDepositBankAccount
fields.description:
Marks the given bank account as the one that is supposed to be used for
tenant's deposit payments.

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

fields.name: decideForNextStatus
fields.description:
Moves the status of Booking Offer to next possible status

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

fields.name: rejectBookingOffer
fields.description:
Reject the current booking offer

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

fields.name: cancelBookingOffer
fields.description:
Cancel the current booking offer

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

fields.name: switchToManualSigningForBookingOffer
fields.description:
Switch from Online Signing flow to Manual Signing

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

fields.name: switchToOnlineSigningForBookingOffer
fields.description:
Switch from Manual Signing flow to Online Signing

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

fields.name: markBookingOfferReviewedByLandlord
fields.description:
Mark a Booking Offer reviewed by Landlord

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

fields.name: reviewBookingOfferForLandlord
fields.description:
Review a booking offer for Landlord
  - While we do not make changes in a booking offer, we always cancel the one, and create another one with updated data.
  - When using Online Signing, we want to offer a privilege to the Landlord, that she/he can make amendments to the contract details as a review step, before signing the contract.
    That's said, we do not want to allow her/him to change all of the fields, but a limited number of fields can be edited.
    This mutation would be used in such cases, where the allowed & edited fields are given, we make some checks, cancel the current contract, & then create a new one with updated data.

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

fields.name: addGroupToShortlist
fields.description:
Add group to shortlist

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

fields.name: addGroupsToShortlist
fields.description:
Add groups to shortlist

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

fields.name: removeGroupFromShortlist
fields.description:
Remove group from shortlist

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

args.name: input
args.description: Input

fields.name: inviteToShortlist
fields.description:
Invite an email to the shortlist

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

args.name: input
args.description: Input

fields.name: removeCollaboratorFromShortlist
fields.description:
Remove a collaborator from the shortlist

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

args.name: input
args.description: Input

fields.name: leaveShortlist
fields.description:
Leave a shortlist

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

args.name: input
args.description: Input

fields.name: revokeInviteToShortlist
fields.description:
Revoke an invitation to the shortlist

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

args.name: input
args.description: Input

fields.name: correctBooking
fields.description:
cancel given bookings & re-create them

Viewer needs to be authenticated.
Viewer needs to have the role "SALES".
Viewer needs to have the role "ACCOUNTING".

fields.name: correctBookingAndSkipEmails
fields.description:
correct the bookings but without sending any emails

Viewer needs to be authenticated.
Viewer needs to have the role "SALES".
Viewer needs to have the role "ACCOUNTING".

fields.name: cancelReminders
fields.description:
cancel reminders for a booking

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

fields.name: addRolesToUser
fields.description:
Add roles from a user.
Viewer needs to have the role "DEVELOPER".

fields.name: removeRolesFromUser
fields.description:
Remove roles from a user.
Viewer needs to have the role "DEVELOPER".

fields.name: openimmoSyncListingUpdate
fields.description: update a listing via the openimmosync service

fields.name: openimmoSyncImageListingUpdate
fields.description: update images of a listing via the openimmosync service

fields.name: uploadImageForGroupId
fields.description:
upload image

Viewer needs to be authenticated. Or have an
    access token allowing the IMAGES_SERVICE_SYNC action.

fields.name: deleteImagesForGroupId
fields.description:
delete images

Viewer needs to be authenticated. Or have an
    access token allowing the IMAGES_SERVICE_SYNC action.

fields.name: createListingRequest
fields.description:
Creates a new Listing Request and attach it to an existing Booking Request or create a new Booking Request if there's none

Viewer needs to be authenticated.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: Upload
types.description: The `Upload` scalar type represents a file upload.

args.name: keyPath
args.description: If not set defaults to the field's name.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax (as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).
